design_system.name: Gilded Ledger
design_system.description: A professional, luxury-inspired ERP interface for the Indian Gold Jewellery market. Merges the precision of fintech with the elegance of high-end retail.

instructions_to_main_agent.general: You are building a Gold Jewellery ERP. The aesthetic must be 'Professional Luxury'. Think 'Old Money Tech'. Use the provided gold color (#D4AF37) sparingly as an accent, not a background. The base should be clean white/stone.
instructions_to_main_agent.fonts: Import 'Playfair Display' for headings and 'Manrope' for body from Google Fonts. This combination is non-negotiable for the brand identity.
instructions_to_main_agent.layout: Use the 'Control Room Grid' for the dashboard. It should feel dense but breathable. Use 'Glassmorphism' for the top navigation bar to give it a premium feel.
instructions_to_main_agent.components: Use Shadcn UI for all interactive elements (Forms, Tables, Dialogs). Customize them to match the 'Gilded Ledger' design system (e.g., change focus rings to Gold, use Serif fonts for Dialog titles).
instructions_to_main_agent.charts: Use Recharts (via Shadcn Charts). Style them with the Gold/Emerald/Charcoal palette. Avoid default rainbow colors.
instructions_to_main_agent.gst_compliance: Ensure all billing/invoice pages have dedicated fields for HSN Code, GSTIN, CGST, SGST, and IGST. This is a hard requirement.
instructions_to_main_agent.mobile: The design MUST be mobile-responsive. Use 'hidden md:block' for complex tables on mobile and replace them with 'Card Views' for smaller screens.

universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for dark colors.
Add micro-animations to all interactive elements.
Use 2-3x more spacing than typical designs.
All interactive elements MUST include data-testid attributes.
